problem.question:
What is output by the code to the 
right when given this input?

value1 is 10
value2 is 12
problem.code:
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.print( sc.next() );
System.out.print( sc.next() );

problem.question:
What is output by the code to the right when
given this input?

2 2.1 3
problem.code:
Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
int sum = 0;
while( sc.hasNextInt() )
  sum += sc.nextInt();
System.out.print( sum );

problem.question:
What is output by the code to the 
right when given this input?

1.2 0.9 .3 -.4 ZZ
problem.code:
Scanner sc = new Scanner( System.in );
int count = 0;
while( sc.hasNextDouble() ){
  count++;
  sc.nextDouble();
}
System.out.print( count );

problem.question:

  // a FileNotFoundException.
  sc = new Scanner( new File(filename) );
 
  int count = 0;

  // rest of method not shown

}

problem.question:
What is output by the code to the 
right if the value 4 is entered
at the call to key.nextInt()?
problem.code:
int[] temps = {7, 13, 16, 12};
Scanner key = new Scanner( System.in );
int d = key.nextInt();

if( d > 0 || d < temps.length )
System.out.print( temps[d] );
problem.c:
The code successfully completes
execution with no output.
problem.d:
There is no output due to a 
syntax error.
problem.e:
There is no output due to an
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right? $
problem.code:
String nums = "-3 9 ST -5 2 32a";
int sum = 0;
Scanner s = new Scanner(nums);
while( s.hasNext() ){
  if( s.hasNextInt() )
    sum += s.nextInt();
  else
    s.next();
}
System.out.print( sum );
problem.d:
There is no output due to a 
syntax error in the code.
problem.e:
There is no output due 
to a runtime error.

problem.question: What is output by the code to the right?
problem.code:
String nums = "-0.5 0.3 A 1A -.5 2";
double sum = 0;
Scanner s = new Scanner(nums);
while( s.hasNext() ){
  if( s.hasNextDouble() )
    sum += s.nextDouble();
  else
    s.next();
}
System.out.print( sum );

problem.question:

executing the code to the right
on the input below?

12 3 4 10 0 3 -2 14
problem.code:
Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
int x = 1, sum = 0;
while (x >= 0) {
  x = input.nextInt();
  sum = sum + x;

problem.question:
Suppose i is initialized to refer to 
a file with integer values separated
by colons. What replaces <*1> in the
code to the right so that the code
sums up all the numbers in i?
problem.code:
InputStream i;
//code to initialize i not shown
Scanner s = new Scanner(i);
<*1>;
int sum = 0;
while (s.hasNextInt())
   sum += s.nextInt();

x to 10, y to 0.5, and s to " 16"?

int x = input.nextInt();

double y = input.nextDouble();

problem.question: Which of the following correctly replaces <*1> in the code to the right?
problem.code:
int x = 0;
String y = "25 36 42 15 1";
Scanner input = new Scanner(y);
while(<*1>)
x += input.nextInt();
out.println(x);
